20110122142627.500|20110122142630.000|TR0|When it comes to extreme sports

20110122142633.333|20110122142636.667|TR0|break new ground.
20110122142636.667|20110122142640.000|TR0|
20110122142640.000|20110122142643.333|TR0|Smashing a hole through the ice
20110122142643.333|20110122142646.667|TR0|before diving into the murky
20110122142646.667|20110122142650.000|TR0|sub-zero depths is just one way
20110122142650.000|20110122142652.500|TR0|thrill seekers are enjoying the
20110122142652.500|20110122142655.000|TR0|winter season.
20110122142655.000|20110122142657.500|TR0|
20110122142657.500|20110122142700.000|TR0|RT's Ivor Bennett joined the
20110122142700.000|20110122142703.333|TR0|brave few willing to take the
20110122142703.333|20110122142706.667|TR0|plunge.
20110122142706.667|20110122142710.000|TR0|
20110122142710.000|20110122142712.500|TR0|[[PKG]]
20110122142712.500|20110122142715.000|TR0|
20110122142715.000|20110122142717.500|TR0|Perched above the unknown with
20110122142717.500|20110122142720.000|TR0|the icy depths below, it
20110122142720.000|20110122142723.333|TR0|requires guts to take the
20110122142723.333|20110122142726.667|TR0|plunge. On the surface it's like
20110122142726.667|20110122142730.000|TR0|a trapdoor to a sinister
20110122142730.000|20110122142733.333|TR0|netherworld, but from below it's
20110122142733.333|20110122142736.667|TR0|beguiling. ce diving in Russia's
20110122142736.667|20110122142740.000|TR0|a popular sport but it's not
20110122142740.000|20110122142742.500|TR0|something to be taken lightly.
20110122142742.500|20110122142745.000|TR0|
20110122142745.000|20110122142747.500|TR0|Stand up the divers are under
20110122142747.500|20110122142750.000|TR0|the ice now which as around 30
20110122142750.000|20110122142753.333|TR0|cm thick. their only contact
20110122142753.333|20110122142756.667|TR0|with the surface is this rope,
20110122142756.667|20110122142800.000|TR0|their safety line in case they
20110122142800.000|20110122142802.500|TR0|get lost. because there is of
20110122142802.500|20110122142805.000|TR0|course only one way out, and
20110122142805.000|20110122142807.500|TR0|that's here.
20110122142807.500|20110122142810.000|TR0|
20110122142810.000|20110122142813.333|TR0|The maximum depth of the dive is
20110122142813.333|20110122142816.667|TR0|9 metres, but the rope allows a
20110122142816.667|20110122142820.000|TR0|horizontal range of 20. With
20110122142820.000|20110122142823.333|TR0|only one exit, surface contact
20110122142823.333|20110122142826.667|TR0|cannot be lost.
20110122142826.667|20110122142830.000|TR0|
20110122142830.000|20110122142832.500|TR0|SB Alexei Pobazhakov, Diving
20110122142832.500|20110122142835.000|TR0|Instructor
20110122142835.000|20110122142837.500|TR0|
20110122142837.500|20110122142840.000|TR0|'it's crucial that the rope is
20110122142840.000|20110122142843.333|TR0|always kept taut. when it's
20110122142843.333|20110122142846.667|TR0|taut, i can pull on it once to
20110122142846.667|20110122142850.000|TR0|ask them if they're OK. see?
20110122142850.000|20110122142852.500|TR0|they tug it once too, telling me
20110122142852.500|20110122142855.000|TR0|it's all right down there.
20110122142855.000|20110122142857.500|TR0|that's how we communicate.'
20110122142857.500|20110122142900.000|TR0|
20110122142900.000|20110122142903.333|TR0|It's these divers' first time
20110122142903.333|20110122142906.667|TR0|under ice. They're taught theory
20110122142906.667|20110122142910.000|TR0|to accompany 3 dives before
20110122142910.000|20110122142913.333|TR0|getting their qualification. It
20110122142913.333|20110122142916.667|TR0|may not be the Coral reef, but
20110122142916.667|20110122142920.000|TR0|that's not the point. Because
20110122142920.000|20110122142922.500|TR0|for these divers, it's about
20110122142922.500|20110122142925.000|TR0|breaking the ice.
20110122142925.000|20110122142927.500|TR0|
20110122142927.500|20110122142930.000|TR0|Fantastic, i feel like a new man.
20110122142930.000|20110122142933.333|TR0|
20110122142933.333|20110122142936.667|TR0|Each diver has two air
20110122142936.667|20110122142940.000|TR0|regulators in case one freezes -
20110122142940.000|20110122142942.500|TR0|a common problem with
20110122142942.500|20110122142945.000|TR0|temperatures outside well below
20110122142945.000|20110122142947.500|TR0|zero.  Air then leaks and the
20110122142947.500|20110122142950.000|TR0|equipment needs defrosting. In
20110122142950.000|20110122142953.333|TR0|the water it's 2 degrees
20110122142953.333|20110122142956.667|TR0|celsius.  with the right gear
20110122142956.667|20110122143000.000|TR0|maximum dive time is 40 minutes.
20110122143000.000|20110122143003.333|TR0|
20110122143003.333|20110122143006.667|TR0|SB Aleksandr Zykov, Diving
20110122143006.667|20110122143010.000|TR0|Instructor
20110122143010.000|20110122143012.500|TR0|
20110122143012.500|20110122143015.000|TR0|'we start with thermal underwear
20110122143015.000|20110122143017.500|TR0|to take any moisture away from
20110122143017.500|20110122143020.000|TR0|the body, then a thicker thermal
20110122143020.000|20110122143023.333|TR0|under-jacket, before the
20110122143023.333|20110122143026.667|TR0|dry-suit on top. We wear gloves
20110122143026.667|20110122143030.000|TR0|too but you have to ensure the
20110122143030.000|20110122143032.500|TR0|joins are water-tight. the hood
20110122143032.500|20110122143035.000|TR0|should cover as much space as
20110122143035.000|20110122143037.500|TR0|possible. if its too big, your
20110122143037.500|20110122143040.000|TR0|head, cheeks and lips freeze.'
20110122143040.000|20110122143043.333|TR0|
20110122143043.333|20110122143046.667|TR0|The most chilling scenario of
20110122143046.667|20110122143050.000|TR0|ice diving is a diver losing his
20110122143050.000|20110122143053.333|TR0|mouthpiece or running out of
20110122143053.333|20110122143056.667|TR0|air. Then it's a case of holding
20110122143056.667|20110122143100.000|TR0|your breath and not letting go.
